sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian forces are reportedly only 25 kilometers from Ukraine's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A shelling is already damaging some of its neighborhoods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to Ukraine's military, Russia is trying to take out the city's north and west defenses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And the country's presidential adviser described the capital as a city under siege. Despite this, Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky said that Ukraine's forces are doing everything to deprive the enemy of any desire to continue the war against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And he added, the losses of Russian forces are enormous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The dynamics of the losses of the occupiers on the 17th day is such that it's sure to say that this is the biggest blow to the Russian army in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Nowhere they've lost more than during these days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Since the beginning of the invasion, the 31st Battalion tactical group of the enemy has lost combat capability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Russian military surrenders not just one by one, but in whole groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Concerns are also mounting for the inhabitants of the southern port of Maripol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: An estimated 1,500 people have been killed in the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And it is running out of food, according to an official from Doctors Without Borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And Ukraine has predicted that Belarus could soon join Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russia's chief spokesman for the Ministry of Defense, Major General Igor Konyshenkov, said in the morning on March 12 a high-precision long-range weapon attacked Ukraine's military infrastructure facilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And he added, the military airfield Voskiv and the main center of radio and electronic intelligence of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in Rovada were put out of the action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: During the day, aviation and air defense of the Russian Aerospace Forces shot down five unnamed aerial vehicles in the air.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Since the war began, President Zelensky has repeatedly asked NATO to intervene, but US President Joe Biden has ruled out direct support for the country, saying it could potentially lead to another world war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia's military has stepped up its offensive in Ukraine and the fighting is now spreading

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: westwards. Euronews correspondent Annalise Borge reports from the western city of Lviv, where thousands of people are trying to flee by train.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: People here in Lviv are in shock and terrified about what may happen next.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The fact that the Russian offensive was expanded today and certain cities nearby were targeted really gave many here a sense sense the war is getting closer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Lviv up until now was a safe haven for many who have escaped Russian strikes in the east and have been waiting here for a plan, for an idea about what to do next.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many we met here at Lviv Central Station today saying that they don't think this place is safe anymore. They were boarding trains to Poland hoping that they can wait across the border for the situation to calm down. We saw heartbreaking scenes of men saying goodbye to their wives to their children. We also saw elderly people struggling to get on those trains, wondering what is going to happen to them. And we heard many people appealing to the West to close the sky, many asking for a no-fly zone over Ukraine, especially now in view of what people here in this country are considering an escalation, this expansion of the Russian offensive into the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Anneliese Borges in Lviv for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A group of mostly volunteers have transformed a sports center in Warsaw into an emergency shelter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Rooms are filled with huge piles of donated items such as diapers and clothes and what was once an arena is now a living area with cots lined up for refugees from ukraine the coordinator of the refugee center said that 1 300 people have already been housed there and she added that the number of those staying here is constantly rotating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: They come, they leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are constantly organizing transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So constant number is impossible to estimate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Over 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since the war started.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And a little under half of that figure are children, while the rest is made up of mostly women and the elderly. And as the number of refugees grow, so do concerns that some of them could be exploited by human traffickers and other forms of abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The risk for these things to happen is very high. A lot of women are trafficked every year, children, because it's a risk not only for women, but also for children. So in times like this, when people mobilize, as you see here, a lot of Romanians mobilize, and I'm very proud, but the risks for other people that can capitalize on the pain of these families is very very high more and more people leaving ukraine are being forced to stay with people they don't know when the war started 95 of the refugees in poland were able to stay with family or friends but now that number has decreased to only 70 we're surprised that there's no information gathering of any kind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And well, I think we're the good guys carrying people back, but there can also be bad guys who are there for bad things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Some safety advice given to refugees includes telling them to keep their phone batteries charged and to document the license plates of cars they get into

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: when vladimir putin ordered his war on ukraine business at this russian restaurant in new york changed overnight with the war oceans away staff say their restaurants have become a culinary front line for americans and despite these posters on their doors they're struggling to get their message across.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We started getting phone calls calling us Nazis, fascists, our restaurants should burn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But I have family in Russia and I have family in Ukraine so it's a personal tragedy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Overnight my business dropped by 60%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Cancelations were cancelled, reservations were cancelled left and right, events were cancelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russian venues across the US have been vandalised as part of the domestic fallout from the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In this New York bar, staff have been verbally abused.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Bartenders are from all over the world, from Poland, Ukraine, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Russia, Armenia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our owner is Jewish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And we don't support that war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's not a Russian war, it's Putin's war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For now, they carry on with their jobs, looking on with the rest of the world at what's unfolding in Ukraine and hoping for peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Italy's culture minister has agreed to the return of major works of art that are currently on loan from Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Officials have asked that 25 pieces in two galleries here in Milan are returned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the UN's cultural agency says it fears for the safety of Ukraine's cultural heritage. And it also has in mind the close links between the Orthodox churches of Russia and Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A site which for us is of great concern in the city of Kiev, which is a World Heritage Site, this site has two very important ensembles, the St Sophia Cathedral and also the Lavra Monastic Complex.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: These two places are testimony to the birth of the Russian Orthodox Church.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, museum workers across Ukraine are trying to protect their exhibits from Russian attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Armenia's foreign minister has made a rare visit to Turkey for a meeting with his counterpart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After decades of hostility that has roots in Turkey's genocide against the Armenians in 1914, both countries are now moving closer together. Around 1.2 million Armenians were either massacred, deported or sent on death marches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In our meeting, we agreed on the continuation of the normalization phase, with the aim of establishing diplomatic relations without preconditions and the opening of borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Azerbaijan is also pleased with the steps that are being taken and the normalization process between Turkey and Armenia. As you know, I was in Baku last Saturday. Azerbaijan supports this process." In 2020, Turkey backed Azerbaijan, helping it defeat Armenia after just six weeks of fighting in a war over the Nagorno-Karabakh breakaway region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Josep Borrell, the European Union's foreign policy chief, also met with the two foreign ministers in Antalya.
